newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: SBC Equity Partners, QCM in German buyout.
newsitem.headline: SBC Equity Partners, QCM in German buyout.

text.p: SBC Equity Partners, a unit of Swiss Bank Corp (SBC) and Germany's QCM Private Equity Fund have acquired a majority in Germany's NWG Servicegruppe together with two of NWG's managing directors.

SBC Equity Partners, SBC Warburg's organisation for private equity investments in Europe, said in a statement that NWG had annual turnover of 600 million marks and was Germany's leading provider of domestic services to hospitals.
SBC Equity Partners and QCM acquired the stake together with NWG directors Rainer Gossmann and Rainer Thomas.
Together with Britain's Compass/Eurest, Duisburg-based NWG owns a 50 percent stake of market leader CCS-Clinic-Catering Service GmbH.
"As a strategic goal, NWG intends to systematically continue its expansion abroad," SBC Equity Partners said.
SBC Equity Partners closely cooperates with Quadriga Capital Management GmbH, a private German equity institution.
Quadriga advises QCM Private Equity Fund.
